alert.note: Alert for Lee (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 6:03PM CDT until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of East Arkansas, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, including streets. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Reports of flooding at intersections in Marianna. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Marianna, Aubrey, Haynes, Brickeys, Soudan, Ball Point, Cody, Felton, Jeffersonville, Scott Valley, Haleside, Dansby, Raggio, Tongin, Westor, Gassett, Four Forks, Whitehall, Kokomo and Oak Forest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
